column1: 1. ABOUT THE FARFETCH GROUP AND THIS PRIVACY POLICY
We are the OLAHA VN Limited (“we”
column4: and are committed to protecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy provides information on how we collect and use personal data. OLAHA VN Limited operates olaha.com and the OLAHA iOS and Android mobile applications (collectively
column5: the "website"). This Privacy Policy sets out the information that we collect
column6: the reasons for which we collect the information
column7: and how we can use and share the information. The website and the services provided by OLAHA are not intended to be used by children. If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy
column8: including any requests to exercise your legal rights
column9: you can contact the OLAHA Data Protection Officer at privacy@olaha.com.

column1: Our website can contain links to and from the websites of our partner boutiques
column5: amongst others. If you follow a link to any of these websites
column6: please note that this Privacy Policy does not apply to those websites. We are not responsible or liable for the privacy policies or practices of those websites
column7: so please check their policies before you submit any personal data to those websites.

column1: By using our website and our services
column2: you acknowledge and accept that your personal information will be processed in the Vietnam. To provide our website and our services
column3: in accordance with the purposes set out above
column4: we may transfer and store the personal information that we collect from you to a destination outside of Vietnam
column6: either to one of our Group Companies
column7: to one of our Partners or to one of the third parties with which we work with
column8: as stated below: o When transferring personal information to one of our Group Companies outside the EEA
column14: we rely on the Commission’s model contracts for the transfer of personal data to third countries (i.e. the standard contractual clauses) pursuant to Decision 2010/87/EU. o We transfer the personal information to one of our Partners outside the EEA
column15: to the extent such transfer is needed to fulfil the contract between you and the Partner which you are ordering the products from. o When transferring personal information to one of our third party services’ providers set out above
column16: we rely on different adequacy measures
column17: as set out below: o Adequacy Decision: we transfer the personal data that we collect from you to conduct fraud checks to Israel
column18: which was found to have an adequate level of protection for personal data under Commission Decision 2011/61/EU of 31 January 2011. o Model Clauses: we rely in the Commission’s model contracts for the transfer of personal data to third countries (i.e. the standard contractual clauses) pursuant to Decision 2010/87/EU when transferring your information to our US service providers who do not adhere to the US Department of Commerce's EU-US Privacy Shield.

column1: Keeping you and your personal information secure is very important to us. We take a number of reasonable steps to try to protect the personal information that you provide
column2: including: Using a Transport Layer Secure (TLS) to encrypt the personal data that you send us during the order process (including any financial information such as credit or debit card details). Requiring you to establish a unique username and password to access your account on our website. • Not keeping details of your credit or debit card that would enable any third party to transact using that credit or debit card (such as your CVV number). • Regularly monitoring our servers and IT systems for possible vulnerabilities and attacks. Unfortunately
column4: the transmission of information via the Internet is not completely secure. We cannot guarantee the security of your personal data transmitted to or through our website
column5: and any such transmission is at your own risk. In particular
column6: please keep in mind that if you voluntarily disclose personal information through other means of communication than the website in a non-protected environment (such as through email
column8: online messages) then that information can be collected and used by others outside of our or your control.

column1: 5. HOW LONG WILL YOU USE MY INFORMATION FOR?
We retain the data you provide to us for as long as you have your account with us and thereafter for such period as you may have questions or a claim in relation to our services
column2: notwithstanding any superior retention period that we may be obliged to observe in accordance with legal requirements applicable to us. In some circumstances you can ask us to delete your data as set out below. After you have terminated your use of our services
column3: we may store your information in an aggregated and anonymized format.

column1: You have certain rights in relation to the personal data we hold about you
column2: which we detail below. Some of these only apply in certain circumstances as set out in more detail below. We also set out how to exercise those rights. Please note that we will require you to verify your identity before responding to any requests to exercise your rights and that can include asking a set of security questions to ensure it is you. When you have appointed someone else to do the request on your behalf
column3: that person and/or organization needs to show a valid power of attorney issued by you. We must respond to a request by you to exercise those rights without undue delay and at least within one month (although this may be extended by a further two months in certain circumstances).
